programme.desc: Sonic, Knuckles and Tails reunite to battle Shadow, a mysterious new enemy with powers unlike anything they've faced before. With their abilities outmatched in every way, they seek out an unlikely alliance to stop Shadow and protect the planet.

programme.title: Doubt
programme.desc: Suspicions of child abuse fuel a traditionalist nun's (Meryl Streep) personal crusade against a popular priest (Philip Seymour Hoffman) who wants to reform her school's strict customs.

programme.title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
programme.desc: Benjamin Button (Brad Pitt) is born an old man in 1918 New Orleans and ages in reverse and, in so doing, becomes intimately familiar with the natures of love and death.

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: Two life sentences for a 1947 double murder land an innocent man (Tim Robbins) in a corrupt Maine penitentiary.

programme.title: Challengers
programme.desc: Tensions run high when a grand slam tennis champion finds himself standing across the net from the once-promising, now burnt-out Patrick, his former best friend and his wife's former boyfriend.

programme.title: September 5
programme.desc: During the 1972 Munich Olympics, an American sports broadcasting crew finds itself thrust into covering the hostage crisis involving Israeli athletes.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: A man in black (Yul Brynner) recruits six hired guns to lead Mexican villagers against the gang of an outlaw (Eli Wallach).

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven Ride!
programme.desc: A marshal (Lee Van Cleef), an Eastern reporter and five ex-convicts rescue widows from Mexican bandits.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven Ride!
programme.desc: A marshal (Lee Van Cleef), an Eastern reporter and five ex-convicts rescue widows from Mexican bandits.

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: Mother and daughter con-artists (Sigourney Weaver, Jennifer Love Hewitt) try to swindle a cigarette tycoon, but things go wrong when one falls in love.

programme.title: 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi
programme.desc: Six members (James Badge Dale, John Krasinski, Max Martini) of the Annex Security Team defend the U.S. Consulate in Benghazi, Libya, from an attack by Islamic militants.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: Enraged by the killing of his wife, Scotsman William Wallace (Mel Gibson) leads a revolt against the tyrannical English king (Patrick McGoohan) in the 13th century.

programme.title: September 5
programme.desc: During the 1972 Munich Olympics, an American sports broadcasting crew finds itself thrust into covering the hostage crisis involving Israeli athletes.

programme.title: Yours, Mine & Ours
programme.desc: A household threatens to burst at the seams when the marriage of two widowed parents creates a family of 18 children.

programme.title: Some Kind of Wonderful
programme.desc: A grease monkey's (Eric Stoltz) tomboy friend (Mary Stuart Masterson) helps him woo a popular girl (Lea Thompson) in their Los Angeles high school.

programme.title: Shaun of the Dead
programme.desc: An aimless TV salesman (Simon Pegg) and his best pal must save their friends and family from the zombies that have overrun London.

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: A new student gets welcomed into the top of the social food chain by an elite group of popular girls called the Plastics. However, when she makes the misstep of falling for the queen bee's ex-boyfriend, she finds herself caught in their crosshairs.

programme.title: Zoolander 2
programme.desc: A special agent recruits former models Derek Zoolander and Hansel to save the world's most beautiful people from a deadly plot.

programme.title: Bottoms
programme.desc: Unpopular best friends PJ and Josie start a high school fight club to meet girls and lose their virginity. They soon find themselves in over their heads when the most popular students start beating each other up in the name of self-defense.

programme.title: A Good Person
programme.desc: After surviving an unimaginable tragedy, a woman emerges from recovery with an opioid addiction and unresolved grief. However, her unlikely friendship with her would-be father-in-law gives her a fighting chance to put her life back together.

programme.title: Blame It on Rio
programme.desc: A middle-aged coffee broker (Michael Caine) eyes his partner's (Joseph Bologna) nubile teenage daughter (Michelle Johnson) on vacation in Brazil.

programme.title: Return of the Seven
programme.desc: The man in black (Yul Brynner) forms a new Magnificent Seven, to save Mexican farmers from slave labor.

programme.title: Return of the Seven
programme.desc: The man in black (Yul Brynner) forms a new Magnificent Seven, to save Mexican farmers from slave labor.

programme.title: Paranormal Activity 3
programme.desc: A videographer becomes obsessed with finding the source of disturbing late-night noises in his home and discovers its terrifying origin.

programme.title: Unseen
programme.desc: Sam, a gas station clerk, receives a random call from Emily, a nearly blind woman who's running from her murderous ex in the woods. Using a phone, Sam becomes Emily's only chance for survival as she guides the terrified woman through a video call.

programme.title: The Town That Dreaded Sundown
programme.desc: A masked maniac terrorizes the same small community where a murderer known as the Phantom Killer struck decades earlier.

programme.title: A Fistful of Dynamite
programme.desc: A thief and a dynamite-tossing Irish revolutionary inadvertently become embroiled in the Mexican Revolution.

programme.title: Dressed to Kill
programme.desc: A psychiatrist (Michael Caine), a prostitute (Nancy Allen) and the son of a slain woman (Angie Dickinson) seek a Manhattan slasher.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: A wealthy womanizer (Tom Cruise) has trouble distinguishing dreams from reality after a car accident leaves him disfigured.

programme.title: Hoodlum
programme.desc: Mobster Ellsworth "Bumpy" Johnson (Laurence Fishburne) vies with rival Dutch Schultz (Tim Roth) for control of illegal gambling in 1930s Harlem.

programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: An aging lawman (Tommy Lee Jones) reflects on his past and laments a changing world while trying to find and protect a hunter who took the cash from a drug deal gone bad.

programme.title: Basic Instinct
programme.desc: A woman suspected of murdering her lover with an ice pick ensnares a San Francisco cop in a web of lust and deceit.

programme.title: The Craft
programme.desc: Teen misfits befriend a suicidal newcomer and strike back at their tormentors with witchcraft in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Rolling Thunder
programme.desc: A Vietnam POW (William Devane) comes home to Texas and soon, with his buddy (Tommy Lee Jones), must avenge his slain family.

programme.title: When Worlds Collide
programme.desc: A pilot (Richard Derr), his girlfriend (Barbara Rush) and lottery winners escape by rocket to another planet before a star hits Earth.

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth II and Prime Minister Tony Blair try to reach a compromise in determining the royal family's public reaction to Princess Diana's death.

programme.title: Star Trek: Section 31
programme.desc: Emperor Philippa Georgiou faces the sins of her past after joining a secret division of Starfleet that's tasked with protecting the United Federation of Planets.

programme.title: Nobody's Fool
programme.desc: Wild child Tanya looks to her buttoned-up, by-the-book sister Danica to help her get back on her feet. As these polar opposites collide, Tanya soon discovers that Danica's picture-perfect life and boyfriend may not be what they seem.

programme.title: G.I. Jane
programme.desc: A female Navy SEALs recruit (Demi Moore) completes rigorous training under a tough officer's (Viggo Mortensen) command.

programme.title: Book Club
programme.desc: Four friends' lives are turned upside down when their book club tackles the infamous "50 Shades of Grey." From discovering new romance to rekindling old flames, they inspire each other to make their next chapter the best chapter.

programme.title: The First Wives Club
programme.desc: Three 50-ish college friends (Goldie Hawn, Bette Midler, Diane Keaton) plot revenge after their husbands dump them for younger women.

programme.title: Motherhood
programme.desc: A bitter New York mom (Uma Thurman) faces unexpected challenges while preparing for her daughter's birthday.

programme.title: Nobody's Fool
programme.desc: Wild child Tanya looks to her buttoned-up, by-the-book sister Danica to help her get back on her feet. As these polar opposites collide, Tanya soon discovers that Danica's picture-perfect life and boyfriend may not be what they seem.

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Alison and Rod unpack their history of bickering; Jessica vents over her feelings for Boris; Mondo feels like a parent with his deaf partner Kyle; Nick and Katherine recount a revelatory trip that sent shock waves through their marriage.

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Kyle reveals the origins of his desire for sexual freedom; Boris and Jessica unravel their whirlwind trajectory; Alison tries a new tactic with Rod; Katherine and Nick throw a party that triggers a deep dive into Nick's relationship with his mother.

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Boris feels like their therapy is making him look like a monster; Orna explores Katherine and Nick's inability to connect; Rod and Alison are challenged on their attack and avoid dynamic; Mondo confronts Kyle over his refusal to be monogamous.

programme.title: G.I. Jane
programme.desc: A female Navy SEALs recruit (Demi Moore) completes rigorous training under a tough officer's (Viggo Mortensen) command.

programme.title: Star Trek: Section 31
programme.desc: Emperor Philippa Georgiou faces the sins of her past after joining a secret division of Starfleet that's tasked with protecting the United Federation of Planets.

programme.title: Bound
programme.desc: A mobster's (Joe Pantoliano) disgruntled girlfriend (Jennifer Tilly) steals $2 million from him with the help of her lesbian lover (Gina Gershon).

programme.title: Mercy
programme.desc: An ex-military doctor finds herself in a fight for survival when the Irish mafia seizes control of the hospital at which she works. When her son is taken hostage, she's forced to rely on her battle-hardened past and lethal skills to save the day.

programme.title: In Her Skin
programme.desc: The parents (Guy Pearce, Miranda Otto) of a missing girl launch a frantic search for their daughter, unaware that the child's former baby sitter (Ruth Bradley) has murdered her.

programme.title: London Town
programme.desc: A teenage boy receives a tape of The Clash's White Riot in the mail from his estranged mother and sets out to find her.

programme.title: London Town
programme.desc: A teenage boy receives a tape of The Clash's White Riot in the mail from his estranged mother and sets out to find her.

programme.title: Soapdish
programme.desc: The star (Sally Field) of a soap opera is rattled by her ex-lover's (Kevin Kline) return to the daytime drama The Sun Also Sets.

programme.title: Monstrous
programme.desc: A terrifying new horror awaits Laura and her 7-year-old son, Cody, when they flee her abusive ex-husband and try to settle into a new life. Still traumatized, their fragile existence is pushed to the breaking point.

programme.title: A Mighty Heart
programme.desc: Mariane Pearl (Angelina Jolie) begins a terrifying search for her husband, journalist Daniel Pearl (Dan Futterman), after he is kidnapped by terrorists in 2002 Pakistan.

programme.title: Bad Moms
programme.desc: Pushed beyond their limits, three overworked and stressed-out mothers (Mila Kunis, Kristen Bell, Kathryn Hahn) go wild after ditching their daily routines.

programme.title: Love, Rosie
programme.desc: Rosie and Alex are best friends until Alex's family moves to America. They gamble everything to keep their love and friendship alive over the years and miles.

programme.title: The Girl on the Train
programme.desc: Rachel, who is devastated by her divorce, spends her commute fantasizing about the couple that lives in a house that her train passes. One morning, she sees something shocking and becomes entangled in a missing person's investigation.

programme.title: Cold Mountain
programme.desc: During the Civil War, a wounded Confederate soldier (Jude Law) abandons his duties to make his way home to his sweetheart (Nicole Kidman).

programme.title: Past Lives
programme.desc: Nora and Hae Sung, two deeply connected childhood friends, are wrest apart after Nora's family emigrates from South Korea. Decades later, they are reunited for one fateful week as they confront destiny, love and the choices that make a life.

programme.title: Minari
programme.desc: A Korean American family moves to an Arkansas farm in search of its own American dream. Amidst the challenges of this new life in the strange and rugged Ozarks, they discover the undeniable resilience of family and what really makes a home.

programme.title: Revolutionary Road
programme.desc: In 1950s Connecticut, two suburbanites (Leonardo DiCaprio, Kate Winslet) become increasingly dissatisfied with their marriage and society's expectations of conformity.

programme.title: Frida
programme.desc: Mexican painter Frida Kahlo (Salma Hayek) marries fellow artist Diego Rivera who shares her radical political views.

programme.title: A Mighty Heart
programme.desc: Mariane Pearl (Angelina Jolie) begins a terrifying search for her husband, journalist Daniel Pearl (Dan Futterman), after he is kidnapped by terrorists in 2002 Pakistan.

programme.title: Mansfield Park
programme.desc: Sent to live with relatives by her impoverished parents, a girl grows up, becomes a writer and falls in love.

programme.title: Cinéma
programme.desc: Jeanne uses her charms and intelligence to climb the social ladder. Against all convention, she becomes one of the favorites of King Louis XV and moves to Versailles.

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Writer J.M. Barrie (Johnny Depp) befriends a widow (Kate Winslet) and her four sons who inspire him to create the character Peter Pan.

programme.title: You Hurt My Feelings
programme.desc: A novelist's long-standing marriage is suddenly upended when she overhears her husband give his honest reaction to her latest book.

programme.title: I.Q.
programme.desc: Albert Einstein (Walter Matthau) plays matchmaker for his egghead niece (Meg Ryan) and an unschooled auto mechanic (Tim Robbins).

programme.title: Sheryl
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter Sheryl Crow rises to superstardom and finds a way to turn even her darkest experiences into captivating, timeless work -- creating a legacy that continues to inspire and influence generations.

programme.title: Breathe
programme.desc: Maya and her young daughter are forced to live underground when Earth is left uninhabitable due to a lack of oxygen. They soon find themselves in a fight for survival when a mysterious couple arrive and claim to know the fate of Maya's husband.

programme.title: The Lodge
programme.desc: During a family retreat to a remote winter cabin, a man leaves his two children in the care of his new girlfriend, Grace. Isolated and alone, a blizzard traps them inside the lodge as terrifying events summon specters from Grace's dark past.

programme.title: Rumours
programme.desc: Leaders of the world's wealthiest democracies become spectacles of incompetence, contending with increasingly surreal obstacles as night falls in the misty woods and they realize they are suddenly alone.

programme.title: The Uninvited
programme.desc: A ghost prompts a lethal battle of wills between a man's new fiancee (Elizabeth Banks) and his two daughters (Emily Browning, Arielle Kebbel), one of whom has just returned from a mental ward.

programme.title: I.S.S.
programme.desc: Tensions flare in the near future aboard the International Space Station when a worldwide conflict breaks out on Earth. Soon, the U.S. and Russian astronauts each receive orders from the ground: take control of the station by any means necessary.

programme.title: Wild Eyed and Wicked
programme.desc: A woman tries to strike back at the medieval creature that's haunted her family for generations. To do so, she must learn how to draw upon a time of steel and blade when armor-clad knights rode out and dueled monsters to the death.

programme.title: Breathe
programme.desc: Maya and her young daughter are forced to live underground when Earth is left uninhabitable due to a lack of oxygen. They soon find themselves in a fight for survival when a mysterious couple arrive and claim to know the fate of Maya's husband.

programme.title: Sheryl
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter Sheryl Crow rises to superstardom and finds a way to turn even her darkest experiences into captivating, timeless work -- creating a legacy that continues to inspire and influence generations.

programme.title: Parallel
programme.desc: Following the journey of Vanessa, a grief-stricken woman who mysteriously finds herself navigating between parallel spaces.

programme.title: Together Together
programme.desc: A young loner becomes a surrogate mother for a single, middle-aged man who wants a child. Their unexpected relationship soon challenges their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love.

programme.title: Becoming Jane
programme.desc: Though her parents expect her to marry a wealthy suitor, young Jane Austen (Anne Hathaway) becomes involved with a penniless lawyer (James McAvoy) who inspires her future writings.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: A young princess (Audrey Hepburn), tired of her constraints, runs off with a U.S. newsman (Gregory Peck) in Rome.

programme.title: Indecent Proposal
programme.desc: A Las Vegas mystery man (Robert Redford) offers a desperate couple (Demi Moore, Woody Harrelson) $1 million for a night with the wife.

programme.title: Nothing Compares
programme.desc: Following the career of singer Sinéad O'Connor through her rise to fame and how her iconoclastic personality led to her exile from the pop mainstream.

programme.title: Twisted
programme.desc: With help from her partner (Andy Garcia), a police inspector (Ashley Judd) searches for a killer who is murdering her former lovers.

programme.title: The Stepford Wives
programme.desc: A man (Matthew Broderick) and his wife (Nicole Kidman) move to a quaint suburb where most of the women seem to have the same bland personality.

programme.title: Nobody's Fool
programme.desc: Wild child Tanya looks to her buttoned-up, by-the-book sister Danica to help her get back on her feet. As these polar opposites collide, Tanya soon discovers that Danica's picture-perfect life and boyfriend may not be what they seem.

programme.title: Jersey Girl
programme.desc: A young woman (Liv Tyler) changes the life of a single father (Ben Affleck) who used to be a successful New York music publicist.

programme.title: Failure to Launch
programme.desc: The parents of a young man (Matthew McConaughey) who still lives at home hire a beautiful woman (Sarah Jessica Parker) to entice him to finally leave the nest.

programme.title: Regarding Henry
programme.desc: Two bullets force a career-driven Manhattan lawyer (Harrison Ford) to start life over with his loving wife (Annette Bening) and daughter.

programme.title: The Stepford Wives
programme.desc: A man (Matthew Broderick) and his wife (Nicole Kidman) move to a quaint suburb where most of the women seem to have the same bland personality.
